results.title: Access News greatest hits 2000. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Campbell Manderson, Pip Starr and SKA TV
results.brief_description:
Access News Greatest Hits 2000 (Part 1 of 2)
SKA TV’s Access News is a grass-roots alternative to mainstream news and current affairs, broadcast weekly on Melbourne’s Community Television station Channel 31 since 1994.
Giving light to perspectives or issues otherwise not seen, stories range from front-line coverage of anti-globalisation protests to satirical critiques of commercial media.
‘Greatest Hits 2000’ is a compilation of 15 of Access News’s best stories from the year 2000.
Highlights from part 1:
Violence is Violence : Hundreds of Sydney residents take over the streets to protest car-dominated public space and offer a vision of urban sustainability. Their celebration is met with a brutal police response.
Fire Water Earth : The world’s largest uranium mine is located at Roxby Downs in South Australia. It is owned by multinational mining corporation WMC and is built on Arabunna and Kokotha land. This story follows the nuclear trail from an occupation of a WMC borefield by Arabunna elder Kevin Buzzacott and his supporters to a daring mission by videoactivists into the heart of WMC headquarters in Melbourne, surprising the boss himself.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Campbell Manderson, Pip Starr and SKA TV

results.title: Acceptable Levels
results.brief_description: John Davies’ incisive drama on the responsibility of the media to those they film and photograph and the abuse of that responsibility in the pursuit of “acceptable” news and entertainment. A drama set in Northern Ireland.

results.title: Accelerating the seventies
results.creator_credit: Fred A Niles Communications Centre and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: A visual description of the progress and potential problems of the rapid advancements of the 1970’s. Using rapid-fire cutting techniques the sense of pace of unchecked growth and its potential is transmitted to the viewer.

results.title: Abstraction
results.creator_credit: ACI Films, American Federation of Arts and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: Shows that abstraction is an essential aspect of daily living. Uses a variety of examples to establish a definition of abstraction and to illustrate how the artist employs it when selecting what is visually and emotionally significant in the creation of their work.

results.title: Abstract designs from nature with Edward Betts
results.brief_description: Observes Edward Betts as he makes several pencil drawings at a quarry. Shows how he develops one of his drawings into a watercolour in his studio.

results.title: Absolution
results.creator_credit: Andrew Lawrence, Tor Larson and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A questioning of religious beliefs and values as seen through the eyes of 11-year-old Malcolm, an altar boy. Malcolm lives with his mother and younger brother in a caravan and earns himself a bit of pocket money by doing jobs and helping out his elderly neighbour, Poppy. When Poppy suffers a stroke, Malcolm is faced with the dubious motives of his own mother and Poppy’s son Charles who is trying to find the Deed Box containing Poppy’s family papers and documents. Malcolm’s ultimate intervention achieves a kind of absolution for them all. Cast includes Malcolm Roberts (as Malcolm), Kim Dawson, Edward Primrose, Cathleen Cooper, Eli Roberts.

results.title: Abseiling
results.brief_description: An instructional film on abseiling techniques. Shows how to set up a classic abseil and a standard abseil and illustrates methods of rope control and descent. Presupposes a knowledge of preparatory techniques. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Abraham Lincoln: a background study
results.brief_description: The life of Abraham Lincoln, 16th President of the United States. Describes the difficulties of his early life, through his early political career and his terms as president during the American Civil War.

results.title: Abraham Lincoln and the emancipation proclamation
results.creator_credit: Robert Gordon, Jesse Sandler and Project Seven Productions
results.brief_description: Examines the dilemma that confronted Abraham Lincoln over the issue of slavery. Traces the steps that led him to make his final decision.

results.title: Above New Zealand
results.brief_description: Take a look at New Zealand as you have never seen it before. Soaring like a bird in low altitude light aircraft and helicopters, swooping down from the clouds occasionally to watch New Zealanders at work and at play. From your viewpoint in the sky you will see the natural forces that shaped New Zealand’s rugged beauty still at work reshaping the land. The history of New Zealand’s Maori and Pakeha peoples also comes vividly alive. Rated: G
